venue.name: Mass AT: Pittsfield Rd., Washington Trailhead

item.description:
Part 6 of the Massachusetts Appalachian Trail! We pass the half way point on this section as we make our way through October Mountain State forest. We will meet at the AT trail head at the intersection of Pittsfield rd and Beach rd in Washington, MA, which will be the ending location of our hike. We'll then leave half the cars and drive over to the AT trail head on route 20 (the ending location of the last hike). The total distance of this hike is 9.4 miles.....total elevation gain is about 1000 ft. Based on our past hiking speeds this will be about a 6 hour hike.

 

Total Mass AT Hiked Before this section: 43.3 out of 89.7 48% Total Mass AT Hiked After this section: 52.7 out of 89.7 59%

 

Is This Hike for Me?

This is a moderate length hike with minor elevation gain. Please bring plenty of water (I'm bringing 3 liters) appropriate hiking attire (no jeans or cotton, hiking boots not sneakers), rain gear in case the weather turns nasty, lunch, and snacks. 

 

Trailhead 

 

The trail head is at the intersection of Pittsfield rd and Beach rd in Washington, MA. Google Maps link to the location:

http://maps.google.com/maps?q=Pittsfield+rd+and+Beach+Road,+Washington,+MA&hl=en&ll=42.37947,-73.143024&spn=0.054843,0.104198&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=59.249168,106.699219&vpsr...

 

Street view of trail:

http://maps.google.com/maps?q=Pittsfield+rd+and+Beach+Road,+Washington,+MA&hl=en&ll=42.377113,-73.150881&spn=0.001714,0.003256&sll=37.0625,-95.677068&sspn=59.249168,106.699219&vps...

 

 

 

 

Trail  Route Information (starting from route 20)

1.1 miles to Becket Mountain (2180 ft)

1.0 miles to Walling Mountain (2200 ft)

3.5 miles to Bald Top Mountain (2047 ft)

1.6 miles to October Mountain Shelter

2.2 to Pittsfield/Beach rd intersection

 

 

Carpool Option

Please use the comments section to coordinate with other hikers if you want to carpool. There is limited parking so car pooling is recommended....just remember that we do have to carspot.

 

Massachusetts Appalachian Trail Series

MAP NOTE: What we have hiked is in black, current section in red, remaining trail red dots.

 

 

Liability Waiver

As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you for yourself, your heirs, executors, and administrators release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons.
item.how_to_find_us: AT Trailhead at the intersection of Pittsfield rd and Beach rd, Washington, MA. Look for a grey Nissan Juke with RI plates. Cell: 508-414-8544. See directions below.
item.name: Massachusetts Appalachian Trail: Part 6
